extension.searchTitle: To amend the Public Health Service Act to provide for the designation of maternity care health professional shortage areas.;Improving Access to Maternity Care Act;H.R. 1209 (RH)

titleInfo.title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to provide for the designation of maternity care health professional shortage areas.
Improving Access to Maternity Care Act

extension.shortTitle: Improving Access to Maternity Care Act
extension.officialTitle: To amend the Public Health Service Act to provide for the designation of maternity care health professional shortage areas.
extension.officialTitleAmendment: A bill to amend the Public Health Service Act to distribute maternity care health professionals to health professional shortage areas identified as in need of maternity care health services.
extension.action: Mr. Burgess (for himself, Mrs. Capps, and Ms. Duckworth) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

Additional sponsors: Mr. Meehan, Ms. Herrera Beutler, Mr. Takai, Ms. Norton, Mr. Conyers, Mr. Rangel, Mr. Blumenauer, Mr. Harper, Mr. Roe of Tennessee, Mr. McGovern, Ms. Eshoo, Mr. Ribble, Mr. Hanna, Mr. Stivers, Ms. DelBene, Mr. Amodei, Mr. Larson of Connecticut, Mr. Grijalva, Mr. DeFazio, Mr. Johnson of Ohio, Mr. Hastings, Ms. Lee, Mr. Polis, Mr. Heck of Nevada, Mr. Pocan, Mr. Ben Ray Luj√°n of New Mexico, Ms. Sinema, Ms. Clark of Massachusetts, Mrs. Comstock, Mr. Costello of Pennsylvania, Mr. Loebsack, Mrs. Mimi Walters of California, Mr. Heck of Washington, Mr. Huffman, Mr. Takano, Mrs. Dingell, Mr. Farr, Mr. Himes, Ms. McCollum, Mr. DesJarlais, Mr. Fattah, Mrs. Brooks of Indiana, Mr. Kilmer, Mr. Walberg, Mrs. Blackburn, Ms. Moore, Mr. Welch, Mrs. Torres, Mr. Kind, Mr. Garamendi, Ms. McSally, Mr. Katko, Mr. Joyce, Mr. Walz, Mrs. Kirkpatrick, Mr. Brendan F. Boyle of Pennsylvania, Mr. Newhouse, Ms. Judy Chu of California, Mr. Dent, Mrs. Miller of Michigan, Mr. Jenkins of West Virginia, Ms. Brownley of California, Mr. Collins of Georgia, Mr. Peters, Ms. DeLauro, Miss Rice of New York, Mr. Benishek, Mr. Moolenaar, Mr. Brady of Pennsylvania, Mr. Latta, Mr. Smith of Missouri, Mr. MacArthur, Mr. Lipinski, Mr. Gallego, Ms. Roybal-Allard, Mr. Jeffries, Ms. Lofgren, Mr. Ross, Mr. Schrader, Mr. Pompeo, Ms. Clarke of New York, Mr. Tonko, Mr. Ted Lieu of California, Mr. Young of Iowa, Mr. Griffith, Ms. Kuster, and Ms. Bonamici
Reported with amendments, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
